content:
AL Class

In this Article

Implements the AL task. Use the AL element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see AL (Assembly Linker) Task.

Syntax

Declaration

public class AL : Microsoft.Build.Tasks.ToolTaskExtension

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • Task
  • ToolTask
  • Microsoft.Build.Tasks.ToolTaskExtension
  • AL

Inherited Members

AddCommandLineCommands(CommandLineBuilderExtension)
,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

,

LogEventsFromTextOutput(String,MessageImportance)
,

Constructors summary

AL()

Initializes a new instance of the AL class.

Properties summary

AlgorithmId

Gets or sets an algorithm to hash all files in a multifile assembly except the file that contains the assembly manifest.
BaseAddress

Gets or sets the address at which a DLL will be loaded on the user’s computer at run time.
CompanyName

Gets or sets the Company field in the assembly.
Configuration

Gets or sets the Configuration field in the assembly.
Copyright

Gets or sets the Copyright field in the assembly.
Culture

Gets or sets the culture string to associate with the assembly.
DelaySign

Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to place only the public key in the assembly (true) or to fully sign the assembly (false).
Description

Gets or sets the Description field in the assembly.
EmbedResources

Gets or sets the resources to embed in the image that contains the assembly manifest.
EvidenceFile

Gets or sets the file to embed in the assembly with the resource name of Security.Evidence.
FileVersion

Gets or sets the File Version field in the assembly.
Flags

Gets or sets the Flags field in the assembly.
GenerateFullPaths

Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to cause the task to use the absolute path for any files that are reported in an error message.
KeyContainer

Gets or sets a container that holds a key pair.
KeyFile

Gets or sets a file that contains a key pair or just a public key to sign an assembly.
LinkResources

Gets or sets the resource files to link to an assembly.
MainEntryPoint

Gets or sets the fully qualified name (class.method) of the method to use as an entry point when converting a module to an executable file.
OutputAssembly

Gets or sets the name of the file generated by this task.
Platform

Gets or sets a string that limits which platform this code can run on; must be one of x86, Itanium, x64, or anycpu.
Prefer32Bit

Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the task runs on a 32 bit platform.
ProductName

Gets or sets the Product field in the assembly.
ProductVersion

Gets or sets the ProductVersion field in the assembly.
ResponseFiles

Gets or sets the names of the response files that contain commands for the AL tool.
SdkToolsPath

Gets or sets the path to the SDK tools.
SourceModules

Gets or sets the modules to be compiled into an assembly.
TargetType

Gets or sets the file format of the output file: library (code library), exe (console application), or win (Windows-based application).
TemplateFile

Gets or sets the assembly from which to inherit all assembly metadata, except the culture field.
Title

Gets or sets the Title field in the assembly.
ToolName

Gets the name of the tool (Al.exe).
Trademark

Gets or sets the Trademark field in the assembly.
Version

Gets or sets the version information for this assembly.
Win32Icon

Gets or sets the .ico file to insert in the assembly.
Win32Resource

Gets or sets a Win32 resource (.res file) to insert in the output file.

Methods summary

AddResponseFileCommands(CommandLineBuilderExtension)

Fills the specified commandLine parameter with switches and other information that can go into a response file.
Execute()

Executes the AL task.
GenerateFullPathToTool()

Returns the full file path to the AL tool.

Constructors

  • AL()

    Initializes a new instance of the AL class.

    public AL ();

Properties

  • AlgorithmId

    Gets or sets an algorithm to hash all files in a multifile assembly except the file that contains the assembly manifest.

    public string AlgorithmId { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The algorithm to hash all files in a multifile assembly except the file that contains the assembly manifest.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /algid option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • BaseAddress

    Gets or sets the address at which a DLL will be loaded on the user’s computer at run time.

    public string BaseAddress { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The address at which a DLL will be loaded on the user’s computer at run time.

    Remarks

    Applications load faster if you specify the base address of the DLLs, rather than letting the operating system relocate the DLLs in the process space. This property corresponds to the /base[address] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • CompanyName

    Gets or sets the Company field in the assembly.

    public string CompanyName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Company field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /comp[any] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Configuration

    Gets or sets the Configuration field in the assembly.

    public string Configuration { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Configuration field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /config[uration] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Copyright

    Gets or sets the Copyright field in the assembly.

    public string Copyright { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Copyright field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /copy[right] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Culture

    Gets or sets the culture string to associate with the assembly.

    public string Culture { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The culture string to associate with the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /c[ulture] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • DelaySign

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to place only the public key in the assembly (true) or to fully sign the assembly (false).

    public bool DelaySign { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if only the public key is placed in the assembly; false if the assembly is fully signed.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /delay[sign] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Description

    Gets or sets the Description field in the assembly.

    public string Description { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Description field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /descr[iption] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • EmbedResources

    Gets or sets the resources to embed in the image that contains the assembly manifest.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] EmbedResources { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The resources to embed in the image that contains the assembly manifest.

    Remarks

    This task copies the contents of the resource file into the image. The items set in this property may have optional metadata attached to them called LogicalName and Access. The LogicalName metadata is used to specify the internal identifier for the resource. The Access metadata can be set to private in order to make the resource not visible to other assemblies. For more information, see the documentation for the /embed[resource] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • EvidenceFile

    Gets or sets the file to embed in the assembly with the resource name of Security.Evidence.

    public string EvidenceFile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The file to embed in the assembly with the resource name of Security.Evidence.

    Remarks

    You cannot use Security.Evidence for regular resources. This property corresponds to the /e[vidence] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • FileVersion

    Gets or sets the File Version field in the assembly.

    public string FileVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The File Version field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /fileversion option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Flags

    Gets or sets the Flags field in the assembly.

    public string Flags { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Flags field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /flags option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • GenerateFullPaths

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to cause the task to use the absolute path for any files that are reported in an error message.

    public bool GenerateFullPaths { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the task will use the absolute path for any files that are reported in an error message; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property corresponds to the /fullpaths option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • KeyContainer

    Gets or sets a container that holds a key pair.

    public string KeyContainer { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The container that holds a key pair.

    Remarks

    This will sign the assembly (give it a strong name) by inserting a public key into the assembly manifest. The task will then sign the final assembly with the private key. For more information, see the documentation for the /keyn[ame] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • KeyFile

    Gets or sets a file that contains a key pair or just a public key to sign an assembly.

    public string KeyFile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The file that contains a key pair or just a public key to sign an assembly.

    Remarks

    The compiler inserts the public key in the assembly manifest and then signs the final assembly with the private key. For more information, see the documentation for the /keyf[ile] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • LinkResources

    Gets or sets the resource files to link to an assembly.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] LinkResources { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The resource files to link to an assembly.

    Remarks

    The resource becomes part of the assembly, but the file is not copied. The items passed in to this parameter may have optional metadata attached to them called LogicalName, Target, and Access. The LogicalName metadata is used to specify the internal identifier for the resource. The Target metadata can specify the path and filename to which the task copies the file, after which it compiles this new file into the assembly. The Access metadata can be set to private in order to make the resource not visible to other assemblies. For more information, see the documentation for the /link[resource] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • MainEntryPoint

    Gets or sets the fully qualified name (class.method) of the method to use as an entry point when converting a module to an executable file.

    public string MainEntryPoint { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The fully qualified name (class.method) of the method to use as an entry point when converting a module to an executable file.

    Remarks

    This property corresponds to the /main option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • OutputAssembly

    Gets or sets the name of the file generated by this task.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem OutputAssembly { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem

      The name of the file generated by this task.

    Remarks

    This property corresponds to the /out option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Platform

    Gets or sets a string that limits which platform this code can run on; must be one of x86, Itanium, x64, or anycpu.

    public string Platform { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that limits which platform this code can run on; must be one of x86, Itanium, x64, or anycpu.

    Remarks

    The default is anycpu. This property corresponds to the /platform option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Prefer32Bit

    Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the task runs on a 32 bit platform.

    public bool Prefer32Bit { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the value of the flag.

  • ProductName

    Gets or sets the Product field in the assembly.

    public string ProductName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Product field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /prod[uct] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • ProductVersion

    Gets or sets the ProductVersion field in the assembly.

    public string ProductVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The ProductVersion field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /productv[ersion] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • ResponseFiles

    Gets or sets the names of the response files that contain commands for the AL tool.

    public string[] ResponseFiles { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      The names of the response files that contain commands for the AL tool.

  • SdkToolsPath

    Gets or sets the path to the SDK tools.

    public string SdkToolsPath { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the path to the SDK tools.

  • SourceModules

    Gets or sets the modules to be compiled into an assembly.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] SourceModules { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The modules to be compiled into an assembly.

    Remarks

    The modules will be listed in the manifest of the resulting assembly, and will still need to distributed and available in order for the assembly to load. The items passed into this parameter may have additional metadata called Target, which specifies the path and filename to which the task copies the file, after which it compiles this new file into the assembly. For more information, see the documentation for Al.exe (Assembly Linker). This property corresponds to the list of modules passed into Al.exe without a specific switch.

  • TargetType

    Gets or sets the file format of the output file: library (code library), exe (console application), or win (Windows-based application).

    public string TargetType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The file format of the output file: library (code library), exe (console application), or win (Windows-based application).

    Remarks

    The default is library. This property corresponds to the /t[arget] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • TemplateFile

    Gets or sets the assembly from which to inherit all assembly metadata, except the culture field.

    public string TemplateFile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The assembly from which to inherit all assembly metadata, except the culture field.

    Remarks

    The specified assembly must have a strong name. An assembly that you create with the TemplateFile parameter will be a satellite assembly. This property corresponds to the /template option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Title

    Gets or sets the Title field in the assembly.

    public string Title { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Title field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /title option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • ToolName

    Gets the name of the tool (Al.exe).

    protected override string ToolName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the tool.

  • Trademark

    Gets or sets the Trademark field in the assembly.

    public string Trademark { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Trademark field in the assembly.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /trade[mark] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Version

    Gets or sets the version information for this assembly.

    public string Version { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The version information for this assembly.

    Remarks

    The format of the string is major.minor.build.revision. The default value is 0. For more information, see the documentation for the /v[ersion] option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Win32Icon

    Gets or sets the .ico file to insert in the assembly.

    public string Win32Icon { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The .ico file to insert in the assembly.

    Remarks

    The .ico file gives the output file the desired appearance in Windows Explorer. This property corresponds to the /win32icon option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

  • Win32Resource

    Gets or sets a Win32 resource (.res file) to insert in the output file.

    public string Win32Resource { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The Win32 resource (.res file) to insert in the output file.

    Remarks

    For more information, see the documentation for the /win32res option in Al.exe (Assembly Linker).

Methods

  • AddResponseFileCommands(CommandLineBuilderExtension)

    Fills the specified commandLine parameter with switches and other information that can go into a response file.

    protected override void AddResponseFileCommands (Microsoft.Build.Tasks.CommandLineBuilderExtension commandLine);

    Parameters

    • commandLine
      CommandLineBuilderExtension

      Command line builder to add arguments to.

  • Execute()

    Executes the AL task.

    public override bool Execute ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if task execution succeeded; otherwise, false.

  • GenerateFullPathToTool()

    Returns the full file path to the AL tool.

    protected override string GenerateFullPathToTool ();

    Returns

    • String

      The full file path to the AL tool.
